availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas W. Miller (Jefferson County, Kentucky, farmer and slaveholder)

body.p: Jefferson County, Kentucky, farmer. Jefferson County, Kentucky, native. Married to Mary C. Kennedy Miller in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on October 22, 1855. Father of Mamie Miller Wetherby, Nannie E. Miller, and Bettie M. Miller Forbes. Farmer in Jefferson County in 1860. Owned ten enslaved persons in Jefferson County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, District 2, p. 1096.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, District 2, p. 256B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film #994040.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #2275.
"Well-Known Farmer succumbs to Death," Courier-Journal (Louisville, KY), February 8, 1908, p. 4.
"Thomas W. Miller (1827-1908)," Find A Grave, Memorial #27844349, accessed May 2, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/27844349.
